013package org.apache.juneau.assertions;
014
015import static java.util.Arrays.*;
016
017import java.io.*;
018import java.lang.reflect.*;
019import java.util.*;
020import java.util.function.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
027
028/**
029 * Used for fluent assertion calls against primitive array objects (e.g. <c><jk>int</jk>[]</c>).
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>Test Methods:</h5>
032 * <p>
033 * <ul class='javatree'>
034 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion}
035 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
036 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#isHas(Object...) isHas(Object...)}
037 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#is(Predicate) is(Predicate)}
038 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#isAny(Predicate) isAny(Predicate)}
039 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#isAll(Predicate) isAll(Predicate)}
040 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#isEmpty() isEmpty()}
041 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#isNotEmpty() isNotEmpty()}
042 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#isSize(int) isSize(int)}
043 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#isContains(Object) isContains(Object)}
044 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#isNotContains(Object) isNotContains(Object)}
045 *    </ul>
046 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
047 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
048 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExists() isExists()}
049 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Object) is(Object)}
050 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Predicate) is(Predicate)}
051 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNot(Object) isNot(Object)}
052 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isAny(Object...) isAny(Object...)}
053 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotAny(Object...) isNotAny(Object...)}
054 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNull() isNull()}
055 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotNull() isNotNull()}
056 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isString(String) isString(String)}
057 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isJson(String) isJson(String)}
058 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSame(Object) isSame(Object)}
059 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameJsonAs(Object) isSameJsonAs(Object)}
060 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSortedJsonAs(Object) isSameSortedJsonAs(Object)}
061 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer) isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer)}
062 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isType(Class) isType(Class)}
063 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExactType(Class) isExactType(Class)}
064 *    </ul>
065 * </ul>
066 *
067 * <h5 class='section'>Transform Methods:</h5>
068 * <p>
069 * <ul class='javatree'>
070 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion}
071 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
072 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#asItem(int) asItem(int)}
073 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion#asLength() asLength()}
074 *    </ul>
075 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
076 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
077 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString() asString()}
078 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(WriterSerializer) asString(WriterSerializer)}
079 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(Function) asString(Function)}
080 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJson() asJson()}
081 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJsonSorted() asJsonSorted()}
082 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asTransformed(Function) asApplied(Function)}
083 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asAny() asAny()}
084 * </ul>
085 * </ul>
086 *
087 * <h5 class='section'>Configuration Methods:</h5>
088 * <p>
089 * <ul class='javatree'>
090 *    <li class='jc'>{@link Assertion}
091 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
092 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setMsg(String, Object...) setMsg(String, Object...)}
093 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setOut(PrintStream) setOut(PrintStream)}
094 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setSilent() setSilent()}
095 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setStdOut() setStdOut()}
096 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setThrowable(Class) setThrowable(Class)}
097 *    </ul>
098 * </ul>
099 *
100 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
101 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauEcosystemOverview">Overview &gt; juneau-assertions &gt; Overview</a>
102 * </ul>
103 *
104 * @param <E> The array element type.
105 * @param <T> The array type.
106 * @param <R> The return type.
107 */
108@FluentSetters(returns="FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion<E,T,R>")
109public class FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion<E,T,R> extends FluentObjectAssertion<T,R> {
110
111   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
112   // Static
113   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
114
115   private static final Map<Class<?>,Function<Object,String>> STRINGIFIERS = new HashMap<>();
116   static {
117      STRINGIFIERS.put(boolean.class, x -> Arrays.toString((boolean[])x));
118      STRINGIFIERS.put(byte.class, x -> Arrays.toString((byte[])x));
119      STRINGIFIERS.put(char.class, x -> Arrays.toString((char[])x));
120      STRINGIFIERS.put(double.class, x -> Arrays.toString((double[])x));
121      STRINGIFIERS.put(float.class, x -> Arrays.toString((float[])x));
122      STRINGIFIERS.put(int.class, x -> Arrays.toString((int[])x));
123      STRINGIFIERS.put(long.class, x -> Arrays.toString((long[])x));
124      STRINGIFIERS.put(short.class, x -> Arrays.toString((short[])x));
125   }
126
127   private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion.class, "Messages");
128   static final String
129      MSG_objectWasNotAnArray = MESSAGES.getString("objectWasNotAnArray"),
130      MSG_arrayWasNotEmpty = MESSAGES.getString("arrayWasNotEmpty"),
131      MSG_arrayWasEmpty = MESSAGES.getString("arrayWasEmpty"),
132      MSG_arrayDidNotHaveExpectedSize = MESSAGES.getString("arrayDidNotHaveExpectedSize"),
133      MSG_arrayDidNotContainExpectedValue = MESSAGES.getString("arrayDidNotContainExpectedValue"),
134      MSG_arrayDidNotContainExpectedValueAt = MESSAGES.getString("arrayDidNotContainExpectedValueAt"),
135      MSG_arrayContainedUnexpectedValue = MESSAGES.getString("arrayContainedUnexpectedValue"),
136      MSG_arrayDidntContainAnyMatchingValue = MESSAGES.getString("arrayDidntContainAnyMatchingValue"),
137      MSG_arrayContainedNonMatchingValueAt = MESSAGES.getString("arrayContainedNonMatchingValueAt");
138
139   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
140   // Instance
141   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
142
143   /**
144    * Constructor.
145    *
146    * @param value
147    *    The object being tested.
148    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
149    * @param returns
150    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
151    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
152    * used on the same assertion.
153    */
154   public FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion(T value, R returns) {
155      this(null, value, returns);
156   }
157
158   /**
159    * Chained constructor.
160    *
161    * <p>
162    * Used when transforming one assertion into another so that the assertion config can be used by the new assertion.
163    *
164    * @param creator
165    *    The assertion that created this assertion.
166    *    <br>Should be <jk>null</jk> if this is the top-level assertion.
167    * @param value
168    *    The object being tested.
169    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
170    * @param returns
171    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
172    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
173    * used on the same assertion.
174    */
175   public FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion(Assertion creator, T value, R returns) {
176      super(creator, value, returns);
177      if (value != null) {
178         var c = value.getClass();
179         if (! (c.isArray() && c.getComponentType().isPrimitive()))
180            throw new BasicAssertionError(MSG_objectWasNotAnArray, value.getClass());
181      }
182   }
183
184   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
185   // Transform methods
186   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
187
188   @Override /* FluentObjectAssertion */
189   public FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion<E,T,R> asTransformed(Function<T,T> function) {  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
190      return new FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion<>(this, function.apply(orElse(null)), returns());
191   }
192
193   @Override /* FluentBaseAssertion */
194   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asString() {
195      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, toString(), returns());
196   }
197
198   /**
199    * Returns an object assertion on the item specified at the specified index.
200    *
201    * <p>
202    * If the array is <jk>null</jk> or the index is out-of-bounds, the returned assertion is a null assertion
203    * (meaning {@link FluentAnyAssertion#isExists()} returns <jk>false</jk>).
204    *
205    * @param index The index of the item to retrieve from the array.
206    * @return A new assertion.
207    */
208   public FluentAnyAssertion<E,R> asItem(int index) {
209      return new FluentAnyAssertion<>(this, at(index), returns());
210   }
211
212   /**
213    * Returns an integer assertion on the length of this array.
214    *
215    * <p>
216    * If the array is <jk>null</jk> or the index is out-of-bounds, the returned assertion is a null assertion
217    * (meaning {@link FluentIntegerAssertion#isExists()} returns <jk>false</jk>).
218    *
219    * @return A new assertion.
220    */
221   public FluentIntegerAssertion<R> asLength() {
222      return new FluentIntegerAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : Array.getLength(value()), returns());
223   }
224
225   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
226   // Test methods
227   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
228
229   /**
230    * Asserts that the contents of this list contain the specified values.
231    *
232    * @param entries The expected entries in this list.
233    * @return This object.
234    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
235    */
236   public R isHas(E...entries) throws AssertionError {
237      Utils.assertArgNotNull("entries", entries);
238      Predicate<E>[] p = stream(entries).map(AssertionPredicates::eq).toArray(Predicate[]::new);
239      return is(p);
240   }
241
242   /**
243    * Asserts that the contents of this list pass the specified tests.
244    *
245    * @param tests The tests to run.  <jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
246    * @return This object.
247    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
248    */
249   @SafeVarargs
250   public final R is(Predicate<E>...tests) throws AssertionError {
251      isSize(tests.length);
252      for (int i = 0, j = length2(); i < j; i++) {
253         var t = tests[i];
254         if (t != null && ! t.test(at(i)))
255            throw error(MSG_arrayDidNotContainExpectedValueAt, i, getFailureMessage(t, at(i)));
256      }
257      return returns();
258   }
259
260   /**
261    * Asserts that at least one value in the array passes the specified test.
262    *
263    * @param test The predicate test.
264    * @return The fluent return object.
265    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed or value was <jk>null</jk>.
266    */
267   public R isAny(Predicate<E> test) throws AssertionError {
268      Utils.assertArgNotNull("test", test);
269      for (int i = 0, j = length2(); i < j; i++)
270         if (test.test(at(i)))
271            return returns();
272      throw error(MSG_arrayDidntContainAnyMatchingValue, value());
273   }
274
275   /**
276    * Asserts that all values in the array pass the specified test.
277    *
278    * @param test The predicate test.
279    * @return The fluent return object.
280    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed or value was <jk>null</jk>.
281    */
282   public R isAll(Predicate<E> test) throws AssertionError {
283      Utils.assertArgNotNull("test", test);
284      for (int i = 0, j = length2(); i < j; i++)
285         if (! test.test(at(i)))
286            throw error(MSG_arrayContainedNonMatchingValueAt, i, getFailureMessage(test, at(i)));
287      return returns();
288   }
289
290   /**
291    * Asserts that the collection exists and is empty.
292    *
293    * @return The fluent return object.
294    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
295    */
296   public R isEmpty() throws AssertionError {
297      if (length2() != 0)
298         throw error(MSG_arrayWasNotEmpty);
299      return returns();
300   }
301
302   /**
303    * Asserts that the collection exists and is not empty.
304    *
305    * @return The fluent return object.
306    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
307    */
308   public R isNotEmpty() throws AssertionError {
309      if (length2() == 0)
310         throw error(MSG_arrayWasEmpty);
311      return returns();
312   }
313
314   /**
315    * Asserts that the collection exists and is the specified size.
316    *
317    * @param size The expected size.
318    * @return The fluent return object.
319    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
320    */
321   public R isSize(int size) throws AssertionError {
322      if (length2() != size)
323         throw error(MSG_arrayDidNotHaveExpectedSize, size, asLength());
324      return returns();
325   }
326
327   /**
328    * Asserts that the array contains the expected entry.
329    *
330    * @param entry The value to check for.
331    * @return The fluent return object.
332    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
333    */
334   public R isContains(E entry) throws AssertionError {
335      for (int i = 0, j = length2(); i < j; i++)
336         if (Utils.eq(at(i), entry))
337            return returns();
338      throw error(MSG_arrayDidNotContainExpectedValue, entry, value());
339   }
340
341   /**
342    * Asserts that the array does not contain the expected value.
343    *
344    * @param entry The value to check for.
345    * @return The fluent return object.
346    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
347    */
348   public R isNotContains(E entry) throws AssertionError {
349      for (var i = 0; i < length2(); i++)
350         if (Utils.eq(at(i), entry))
351            throw error(MSG_arrayContainedUnexpectedValue, entry, value());
352      return returns();
353   }
354
355   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
356   // Fluent setters
357   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
358
359   // <FluentSetters>
360
361   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
362   public FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion<E,T,R> setMsg(String msg, Object...args) {
363      super.setMsg(msg, args);
364      return this;
365   }
366
367   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
368   public FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion<E,T,R> setOut(PrintStream value) {
369      super.setOut(value);
370      return this;
371   }
372
373   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
374   public FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion<E,T,R> setSilent() {
375      super.setSilent();
376      return this;
377   }
378
379   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
380   public FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion<E,T,R> setStdOut() {
381      super.setStdOut();
382      return this;
383   }
384
385   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
386   public FluentPrimitiveArrayAssertion<E,T,R> setThrowable(Class<? extends java.lang.RuntimeException> value) {
387      super.setThrowable(value);
388      return this;
389   }
390
391   // </FluentSetters>
392
393   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
394   // Utility methods
395   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
396
397   private E at(int index) {
398      return valueIsNull() || index < 0 || index >= length2() ? null : (E)Array.get(value(), index);
399   }
400
401   private int length2() {
402      return Array.getLength(value());
403   }
404
405   @Override
406   public String toString() {
407      if (valueIsNull())
408         return null;  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
409      return STRINGIFIERS.get(value().getClass().getComponentType()).apply(value());
410   }
411}
